column4: I've got a problem installing Feisty on a new AMD64 box and it's stumping me. I was able to boot the live cd if I use the noapic kernel option, but now that it's installed, it hangs at "Reading files needed to boot...".
I can't get any further then that

Not really ... I have just recently installed Ubuntu Server on a 8-CPU Opteron machine and so I assume that it should work under normal circumstances. Maybe your CD drive doesn't like the media you burnt your ISO on to?
well, thats the thing. I was able to get it to install. this issue is with booting off the hard drive
right. it's installed. this is booting from hd. In the recovery mode kernel I see it boot until it just stops at "Reading files needed for boot"
sounds like something got messed up ...
how soon after the boot does this happen?
a bit into it. it's not imediate
but it's consistant. it boots to that point and stops
I'm reinstalling, this time from a gutsy tribe 2 amd64 disk. so far I had to use noacpi to get the install disk to boot.
I'm going to download the 32bit version of gutsy and see if that works.
